what: Data reporting format for STOP's exposure data format.
title: Data reporting format for STOP's exposure data format.
text: Basic version data format, (controlled) vocabulary, standardised export functions STOP’s eData format. Used Shiny app Copper AEP. versioned well, particularly consistent, ’m hurry, least passes check()?

title: CREED Assessment Scoring Choices — CREED_choices_vocabulary
text: Returns standardised CREED assessment scoring options

title: CREED Assessment Scoring Choices — CREED_choices_vocabulary
text: Named character vector CREED scoring choices

what: Abbreviate string to first n words with case formatting — abbreviate_string
title: Abbreviate string to first n words with case formatting — abbreviate_string
text: Takes string, extracts first n words (removing special characters), formats according specified case style.

title: Abbreviate string to first n words with case formatting — abbreviate_string
Abbreviate string to first n words with case formatting — abbreviate_string
text: string Character. input string abbreviate. n_words Integer. Number words include abbreviation. case Character. Case style output. One : "lower" - lowercase, separator (e.g., "dogsandcats") "upper" - uppercase, separator (e.g., "DOGSANDCATS") "sentence" - sentence case, separator (e.g., "Dogsandcats") "snake" - lowercase underscores (e.g., "dogs_and_cats") "title" - title case, separator (e.g., "DogsAndCats") "screamingsnake" - uppercase underscores (e.g., "DOGS_AND_CATS") "camel" - camel case (e.g., "dogsAndCats")

title: Abbreviate string to first n words with case formatting — abbreviate_string
text: Character. abbreviated formatted string.

title: Abbreviate string to first n words with case formatting — abbreviate_string
code: abbreviate_string("Total Phosphorus Concentration", n_words = 2L, "snake") #> [1] "total_phosphorus" abbreviate_string("dogs and cats", n_words = 3L, "title") #> [1] "DogsAndCats" abbreviate_string("Water Quality Index", n_words = 3L, "camel") #> [1] "waterQualityIndex"

what: Export Multiple Datasets as ZIP of CSV Files — export_campaign_zip
title: Export Multiple Datasets as ZIP of CSV Files — export_campaign_zip
text: Creates ZIP archive containing CSV files non-empty dataset provided list. Useful bundling campaign data download archival.

title: Export Multiple Datasets as ZIP of CSV Files — export_campaign_zip
Export Multiple Datasets as ZIP of CSV Files — export_campaign_zip
text: dataset_list Named list tibbles/data.frames export. Names match expected dataset names (e.g., "edata_sites", "edata_measurements"). Empty datasets (NULL, 0 rows) automatically filtered . campaign_name Character. Campaign identifier used ZIP filename individual CSV filenames. Special characters replaced underscores. Default "Unknown_Campaign". output_path Character. Full path ZIP file saved. NULL (default), saves current working directory auto-generated name.

title: Export Multiple Datasets as ZIP of CSV Files — export_campaign_zip
text: Character. Path created ZIP file (returned invisibly).

title: Export Multiple Datasets as ZIP of CSV Files — export_campaign_zip
text: function: Filters empty NULL datasets Creates timestamped filenames reproducibility Writes CSVs Excel-compatible encoding Cleans temporary files automatically Provides progress messages export ZIP filename format: {campaign_name}_{timestamp}.zip CSV filename format: {campaign_name}_{dataset_name}_{timestamp}.csv

title: Export Multiple Datasets as ZIP of CSV Files — export_campaign_zip
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Create sample datasets my_data <- list(   edata_sites = tibble(SITE_CODE = "S01", SITE_NAME = "Site 1"),   edata_measurements = tibble(VALUE = c(1.2, 3.4)) )  # Export to ZIP zip_path <- export_campaign_zip(my_data, "MyStudy2024")  # Export to specific location export_campaign_zip(my_data, "MyStudy", "~/Downloads/export.zip") } # }

title: Generate Protocol ID —- — generate_protocol_id
text: Generates standardised protocol identifier based protocol type, name, sequence number, campaign. function fully vectorised can handle multiple protocols simultaneously.

title: Generate Protocol ID —- — generate_protocol_id
text: protocol_type Character vector. category protocol (e.g., "Sampling Protocol", "Analytical Protocol"). Must match one predefined categories default "X". protocol_name Character vector. specific name/method within protocol category. abbreviated cleaned ID generation. sequence_number Numeric vector. Sequential number protocols within category. Defaults 1. zero-padded 2 digits. campaign_name Character vector. Name campaign/study. abbreviated first 10 alphanumeric characters. Defaults "".

title: Generate Protocol ID —- — generate_protocol_id
text: Character vector protocol IDs format: TypeCodeSequenceNumber_AbbreviatedName_CampaignAbbrev : TypeCode: S (Sampling), F (Fractionation), E (Extraction), (Analytical), X (Unknown) SequenceNumber: Zero-padded 2-digit number AbbreviatedName: 15 alphanumeric characters (optional) CampaignAbbrev: 10 alphanumeric characters (optional)

title: Generate Protocol ID —- — generate_protocol_id
text: function handles edge cases gracefully: NULL empty values result appropriate defaults Invalid protocol types default "X" Names cleaned special characters spaces Empty components omitted final ID

title: Generate Protocol ID —- — generate_protocol_id
code: # Single protocol generate_protocol_id("Sampling Protocol", "Water Sample", 1, "MyStudy") #> [1] "S01_WaterSample_MyStudy" # Returns: "S01_WaterSample_MyStudy"  # Multiple protocols (vectorised) types <- c("Sampling Protocol", "Analytical Protocol") names <- c("Water Sample", "LC-MS Analysis") sequences <- c(1, 2) generate_protocol_id(types, names, sequences, "Study2024") #> [1] "S01_WaterSample_Study2024"  "A02_LcmsAnalysis_Study2024" # Returns: c("S01_WaterSample_Study2024", "A02_LCMSAnalysis_Study2024")

title: Generate Reference ID — generate_reference_id
text: Generate Reference ID

title: Generate Reference ID — generate_reference_id
text: date Date (ACCESS_DATE current date) author Author string title Title string

title: Generate Reference ID — generate_reference_id

text: Creates empty tibble standardised column structure biota data. Biota data extends sample information species-specific details including taxonomic classification, tissue type, life stage, gender information.

title: Initialise Compartments Data Tibble — initialise_compartments_tibble
text: Creates empty tibble standardised column structure environmental compartment data. Compartments define environmental matrix measurement context sampling activities. One immediate child: create_compartment_combination() mod_compartments_fct.R

title: Initialise Parameters Data Tibble — initialise_parameters_tibble
text: Creates empty tibble standardised column structure parameter data. Parameters define chemical substances, physical properties, biological markers measured, including classification chemical identifiers. Two immediate children: create_new_parameter() create_existing_parameter() mod_parameters_fct.R

title: Initialise Parameters Data Tibble — initialise_parameters_tibble
